roleset.name: to divide or separate
roleset.note: SEVER-V NOTES: Member of Vncls separate-23.1, remove-10.1. (from sever.01-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The Singapore and Kuala Lumpur stock exchanges are bracing for a turbulent separation , following Malaysian Finance Minister Daim Zainuddin 's long-awaited announcement that the exchanges will sever ties .

example.name: passive participle
example.text: They stopped short of [*] resuming [diplomatic ties]-1 , severed [*]-1 in 1979 .

roleset.name: able to be severed
roleset.note: SEVERABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data, sever-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls separate-23.1, remove-10.1. (from severable.01-j)

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Even the administration concedes that the individual mandate is not severable from the prohibition on considering pre-existing conditions.
example.arg: from the prohibition on considering pre-existing conditions
